intro: Cyrtandra sublanea, commonly known as the Hawaiian violet, is a flowering plant native to the island of Oahu in Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, violet-colored flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as rainforests and is often found in rocky or mossy habitats. Cyrtandra sublanea is an important component of Hawaii's native flora and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of the region. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of the island's ecosystems.
